comments.comment: I love how Ken has explained his jaw surgery multiple times to Felix and Felix is just as shocked every time.

That mom is the reason why society is becoming  desensitized and more skeptical. People want to help those in need, but people like her ruin it for those that truly have horrible issues. She's terrible!!!

I used to be best friends with a girl in hs who faked having cancer. I had random people running up to me telling me that she has lung cancer or brain cancer. She was telling people she was on oxygen at home and heavy breathing treatments. I looked at them so confused like, "what??? I was just at her place last night, and she didn't have any of this, thats funny." I spent almost everyday with her. She knew that my cousin had died as a kid from brain cancer. She knew my great grandpa had died a year prior from throat cancer, and that was the 3rd time of him having it. And my aunt at the time had breast cancer, along with my uncle having throat cancer. I dropped her IMMEDIATELY. I don't play with that.

"It's ok not to speak to your parents" This is actually a great message. If someone in your life is toxic just keep in mind that that's an option. You don't have to endure abuse. We draw bounaries not because we don't love, we draw boundaries not because we fail to forgive. We draw boundaries to protect ourselves and because trust has to be earned

It’s people like her that make people question actual disabled people like me. I basically lived in the hospital most of my life and people are still surprised when I say I’m still sick. That’s the CHRONIC in chronic illness.

My grandmother pulled the "I'm a cancer survivor" card when she didn't have cancer. The woman just looks for attention where she can get it. She's probably the old woman in the neighborhood that has terrible kids and grandkids that never visit her, but the people she tells that to will never understand what an incredibly evil woman she is.
Such a strong daughter should applaud the fact she turned out so well considering the crazy mum lol
Thinking about Pewds and Marzia, Ken and Mary and the kids being happy and living their best lives as thoroughly decent folk honestly cheers me up.
When you have a loved one die of cancer, stuff like this just really drains the tiny amount of hope you had in humanity
moment of silence to all who lost their life to this disease
It's crazy how people can lie to take advantage of others and become victims when someone does the same to them.
I'm so proud of pewds for inspiring Ken not to be ashamed of the fact that he has no legs. What a role model.
"it's okay to not speak to your parents, it's fun" I can approve of this statement

My dad had a brain disease that caused blood clots all throughout his brain and required brain surgery to fix. After he went through brain surgery and got a lot of attention, he started faking multiple other illnesses to the point he was diagnosed with Munchausen syndrome (not the same as Munchausen by proxy). He craved attention and would get it by telling people he was terminal. He was 'terminal' for almost a decade and eventually died from suicide. I miss him every single day but I still have a lot of anger toward him. I used to dream about confronting him like this, but it often just makes it worse. People like this need help, but it's damn near impossible to force them to get it.

my mom is exactly like this, but even worse.. she admitted herself into the hospital the same week she was going to be evicted, hospital found nothing wrong with her but kept her for nearly a week because she wouldn't stop complaining. My child brother and sister had to walk themselves to school because she has no support system as she's alienated everyone. they came home from school to find a lock on the door and had nowhere to go. they were 10 and 11. i hate my mother, and wish i could get her the help she needs, but she'll never admit she has any flaws.

My mother did the same. All my childhood she lied she has a breast cancer and under the treatment. When I was a kid I was so sad and worried about her. Now I’m 22 and I know she’s pathological liar and said her friends I’m sick too. She’s evil woman and till this day she denies everything and still believes she’s sick. When doctors say otherwise she just changes doctors and it’s all over again.

I have someone close to me who actually   is in the last stage. Now it's just waiting and enjoying whats left. The fact that some are lying about this without understanding how devastating it actually is... I have no words
I love their chemistry. They are just two guys hanging out, having fun.
It's always wholesome when it's a ken and pewds video
My fiance lost his mom to this disease and she fought so hard.. I never got to meet her, she was the light of his life. This makes me sick

I hate this because this is exactly like my mom. I was her care taker for years, lost my childhood, and my early adulthood caring for her. Taking her to doctors just to have them tell her “nothing is wrong with you” till she finally found a doctor that believed her when she said she has strokes and seizures. It’s so sad, but at least this lady is actively being out there. I had to listen to my mom lay in a bed saying “I’m dieing soon” for 12 years. I had to eventually cut her out of my life. I mentally handle watching my mom slowly ruin her life.
I'm ever so curious how a 1 hour podcast format would sound like with these two
This videos are an escape to all the flashy and fast videos in the internet nowadays. So relaxing just watching these two stop the video 200000 times just to laugh together
This is like "you're not the father" but "you do not have cancer".
Man i love these guys so much. Im so glad that i existed in this timeline where i can laugh to them goofing around
my mom's ex husband faked cancer for an entire year before he couldn't keep up the front anymore and attacked my mom in our house, psychopaths are scary man.
My heart goes out to you both. I cant believe you've been living all this time without legs :(
its actualy terrifying how much you can mess up another human being by not being able to say no
I love the 17 strokes, cuz I know someone who had two, and became completely immobile
Pewdiepie doesn't care anymore and it shows. It's actually awesome. Keep posting.

I worked with someone who faked cancer. The way we found out was cuz the new manager that came in had the balls to ask for a doctor's note or to not come back. She didn't come back. Cuz for some reason the management before didn't ask for any documentation. But this lady was saying she was an hour late cuz she was coming to work from chemo... You don't go to work after chemo
She radiates "My dog stepped on a bee" energy.
They actually gave her a title for "Most Stokes had during championship" she had a stroke for every title, then a few on the way home.
My dad, both grandmas, stepmom, and uncles who got real cancer not knowing they could've just faked it watching this like ️️

I actually had cancer when I was 15 and when I told some of my friends and acquaintances and one of them thought I was lying. At that time I was like who would lie about something like that, but now I see.
I just love that ken and felix have been doing this for so many years and are still goin strong. What a solid bromance

I used to work with a girl who always lied for attention saying she hooked up with other coworkers and whatnot and one day she decided to tell everyone she had cancer but then we found out she didn't. So glad I don't work with her anymore.
Felix "practicing the smile" in his school picture is adorable.
As someone who survived cancer, it boils my blood to see people fake it for attention.
Ken has a very addictive smile, what a guy
have you seen what 1 seizure has done to someone 17 seizures would probably kill someone and thats why we should praise this women for being a gladiator among the totally real cancer she had
The second she started speaking it reminded me of an ex-best friend, the type of person who sucks the energy out of a room because they always need all the attention on them.
I absolutely love the surprise of Ken whenever he’s on a video.
i've had brain cancer and people who fake cancer diagnoses and stuff like that are more brain damaged than i am
I feel like the Ken getting metal jaw is like deja vu. And I’m here for Felix being shocked about it the same way as last time.

i love how most liars, when getting called out, literally go to the classic ''are you calling me a liar? are you saying i made this up?''
yes....yes we are...thats exactly what we are saying
''how could even think that i would lie like that? what kinda person do you think i am?!''
a liar...because you lied.

Omg she's just like my aunt. She's had so many 'health problems' that never existed and she's scammed so many people for money with it and she's been called out but she lies so much she buys into her own lies. She lies about literally everything.

People like her are the reason people like me with ACTUAL chronic illnesses aren't believed. Especially when they're invisible illnesses. I'm not faking shit I actually have an immune system that attacks my own body and that means some days walking isn't happening depending on my pain levels or that yes I do get dislocations often because I also have a freaking connective tissue disorder. Ugh I hate ppl.
Loving these collabs with Ken , I'm glad they do them even when they are moving all around the globe :)
She had one stroke for every weight lifting title she had. What an American hero
Healthiest Jilly Juice drinker:

I have a friend of 10 years that I had to distance myself from for this exact reason. He’s super insecure and has had some issues being accepted by his family for personal reasons, and he’s always been a compulsive liar. I had to cut ties with him when he started claiming he had leukemia to gain popularity in the drag community. My grandmother has barely survived cancer multiple times so it’s personal to me. This friend and i were roommates for a while, so we shared each other’s location, I had to draw the line when he told me he was at the hospital getting a blood transfusion but his location showed him at home. Cancer is not something to lie about, I was willing to support him and help him grow as a person until that moment.
The last frame with both of them smiling with their eyes closed is giving me so much serotonin lmao

I really hate people like this, my mom passed away last year from stage 4 kidney cancer. Watching her go through that was more painful then anything I’ve ever had to go through, really hope karma catches up to anyone using a lie to catch popularity. Cancer is no joke.

I had an ex girlfriend lie about having cancer years ago.
Still have not recovered from the trust issues that spawned. My brain can not comprehend how someone could lie about something like that just to take advantage of people.

The dental issue that Ken was talking about sounds like a stage 2 or 3 Maxillofacial condition, I had a similar operation. It's basically when your upper or lower jaw does not grow to match the opposite jaw. They take bone from the larger jaw and used it to expand the smaller one so that they line up. I also have the Titanium screws and metal plate in my jaw which is always fun at the dentists. I think the operation is called an Osteotomy.

I love that these two still do videos together 
Never stop please, so many things in life change or end and this, these videos, they keep me sane when things are changing or I’m dealing with the adulting of a single mom of 3 lol. I hope they both always keep their fire and vigor for creating videos together and individually.
Felix and Ken together gives me life. For real. I can't get enough
I can relate to this lady. I’ve had my entire body removed due to Ligma. I had to change my name too. I’m now known as Terry Crews.
Almost spit out my drink a few times with this one lol loved the throwback  pics.
I just think it’s hilarious that the mom thought it was a good idea to go on Dr. Phil and thought it was going to go well for her.

When my sister and i’s mom passed away (I was 6) my dad tried to keep us in contact with her side of the family, like my grandma and great grandma. They basically chose to ignore it and not be in our lives anymore so we lost ties, and they were horrible to us and our mom. We grew up without them, and then they decided they wanted to reconnect (I think they saw us doing better in life and also just regretted cutting off ties with their grandkids) and so my grandma tried faking cancer to get us to meet with her. We didn’t. (This was like over 10 years after the passing of our mom). A couple of years ago, she ended up ACTUALLY getting cancer and passed awaythe more I hear about her though she was a terrible person and was actually vile, and it’s just funny to me that she tried to fake cancer to get us to pity her and be with her and then it didn’t work and she later ended up actually getting cancer
11:41 the way pewds face changed lmao
My mother did this. Took all my savings just before I turned 18. I didn’t realize there was legal action I could’ve taken and by the time I did it had been so long I just let it go.
I love that in every video they film together they at some point just stray away from the subject so hard, it's totally what I'm here for

My mother recently passed away from her second battle with cancer. She was a breast cancer survivor, and then developed liver cancer and lost that fight. People like this just make me sick. It's not a game, it's not something you can just make up to get sympathy. Cancer fucking sucks and people like this who pretend to have it should just be condemned.

i love watching Pewds and Ken make these videos together. Ken's other ones are still good, but there's so much synergy between them as friends. It makes for a really entertaining video. Both these guys had me laughing so much for this one.
So inspiring to see people with no legs do content.  Proof that anyone can do it. Kudos Ken and Pewds.  Sorry to hear about your legs.  Stay strong
I kinda feel sad that Ken looks so old now. I’ve been following these guys for 13 years now time flies man
11:17 pewds looks like a padawan that got axed during order 66
10:40 ken aged 20 years in 20 seconds
1:38 me at math class suddenly remembering a 3-year old joke:
6:46 My dog stepped on a bee

I legitimately had a friend like this in highschool. She lied to us and the entire school that she had cancer.  We would take her in a wheelchair to her classes. We found out later from her parents that she was lying.
i love that the moment the sponsor is over is the most replayed of the video
My god I just love it when they collab, peak entertainment.

“I was born with glass bones and paper skin. Every morning I break my legs, and every afternoon I break my arms. At night, I lie awake in agony until my heart attacks put me to sleep.” - The clout money fish from SpongeBob

this reminds me of when my boyfriends ex told him she had cancer before him & i started dating. she had him believing for months she was gonna die soon, going out of her way to lie about doctor visits & whatnot. when she found out he was talking to me after they broke up she tried to guilt him about not staying with her & told him “you couldn’t at least make my last few weeks alive worth it?” or some shit along those lies. it was really messed up. when she got caught on her bs she just tried to flip it & blame him, i don’t know that she ever really truly gave a genuine apology either. i don’t understand how people can lie about something like that. (she also lied about being admitted to a psych ward & about having an abortion. she made him help her name the “dead” baby)

i remember being 13 and reading  the fault in our stars and reading it so passionately that i convinced myself i needed to lie to my best friend that i had cancer when all i was being diagnosed was for the first time i got a mild asthma attack lmfao. and now that we're both grown up, we both know i was ballin and im still so ashamed of it, i don't acknowledge i ever said it
She is really caught up in her delusion that she doesn't want to hear anyone tell her the truth and challenge it
I've known two people who faked cancer. One of them took donations and got in big trouble for it. I think she was even on the news about it once.
10:17 ROCK LEE??! IS THAT YOU?!
12:40 i think some of the screws got loose

My mom actually had cancer in her abdomen. I was a child so I don’t remember what it was but it wasn’t pancreatic it was something else. But she literally had parts of her stomach and other organs removed because of it and I remember her recovery and they practically butchered her, like she had bile coming out of a hole in her stomach that wasn’t intentional that smelled so bad I literally didnt want to be in the same room as her. It was bad. My mom didnt fake that horror, she couldnt have. She still bears the scars and the side effects of the surgery that she now struggles with diabetes. I cant imagine how people can make up stories and play pretend in something so awful. Its not a joke. I’m lucky my mom is even still alive. People like that mom need seriously mental help.
Geez guys your killing me!!!! Love you both!!!
Felix & Ken are always a winning combo, keep it up! Love you guys!
Felix ages like a fine wine, he looks so good

I’ve had several brain AVMs (Arteriovenous malformations) and after treating them I had epilepsy attacks and migraines however I never had any cancer related ailments in my life. I couldn’t however write and forgot to speak for two months. I had depression since I couldn’t even get the words of my frustration out but I’ve recovered and moved on with seizure medications to take. It’s sad to know there’s people who lie about having fake illnesses.
Ken has told his injury story atleast 5 times and every time pewds forgets lol

Thank you Felix for this video, i most certainly isn't anyone and i won't expect you or anyone else to see this but. I recently gone thru the most ammount of mental pain i've ever suffered and seeing you laugh still makes me giggle. Ur my hero, you've always been. Thank you for always being you!
Love how Pewds believed everything up until she said she was a world champion

When I was 13 I lied about having cancer to a few people obviously to get attention, of course it came out I don’t, Very embarrassing. I went to therapy and learnt the psychological reasoning why I lied was simply because I wanted love and attention, and thought I needed to go drastic measures to make people care because I felt unlovable. It’s very crazy thing your brain does , and I’m glad I got help… I was too embarrassed to admit it for years but now I’m older I know it’s okay as long as you take responsibility for your actions , face them, change ,become a better person. Also taught me to be genuine and il get the right love and attention in my life I’m supposed to have. If your going through similar, just go talk to someone, it really does help
16:04 "Ma'am you have a stack of IQ"

That's pure marketing right there

How could she live with herself? Cancer is something very serious, all the people I've lost and the two people who I hold dear who are still alive suffered/suffer so much from it. The pain, the fear, it's cruel and people shouldn't try to use it for attention, it's way too cruel for that.
Also love the comic relief you boh put in this video, you're both the best Felix and Ken, can't choose between you two..
I'm honestly so blessed that my parents aren't like this
Im so happy to see both of them together make me laugh a lot

Honestly, because he doesn't post much anymore I actually watch his ads instead of skipping past them.
Man , seeing Felix's old hair brought a lot of memories. Does anyone remember that Kazoo kid video?
Ken and Felix roasting her looks sounds like a couple of mean girls at the lunch table. And I love it.

Lying about a terminal illness is just as bad as lying about your own identity. Seems like there's just some people out there who are hell bent on getting the popularity or attention they think they deserve.
10:25 ITs toad form the new Mario Movie.
I love seeing Ken and Pewds making videos together. They make the perfect duo!
Man i love this videos of pewds with ken they made me crack up laughing nearly the whole time
I love how Pewds is just accepting Kens “if todays your birthday, happy birthday” line is part of the outro now
True story: My mom had leukemia, survived and went on to win several national competitions in weight lifting a few years later.
I love how you both share the same humor since forever.
10:35 ken looks like he doesn’t approve of Capes.
Ken is the new mc of an anime, its not rent a girlfriend its rent a family
Imagine having that much confidence as Patricia
You just gotta love Ken. He seems like the best dad ever <3
The head tilt and piercing gaze compelled me to say thank you. You'll be a great dad lol

I had a first aunt who faked cancer because my second aunt genuinely had it for years and evantually lost her battle to it sadly. The first aunt was faking before the second had passed and I kid you not it was right around Christmas time and on December 24th(also my birthday) she decided to announce it “low-key” to have all the attention on her, she was claiming it was a worse stage than the second aunts all this blah blah blah and a week later it’s completely gone…I don’t keep in touch with that side of the family anymore.

separate...you guys are adorable 
together  you are funnier  and more adorable
2:37 I actually said thank you out loud and the dinner table and everything just looks at me in silence
